assignments.description:
Instructions

  • This is a Calibration Quiz to assess your familiarity with the prerequisites for COMS 4771.
  • The goal of this quiz is for you to assess your preparedness to take this course. It is designed to test you on your knowledge of basic applied probability, statistics, linear algebra and vector/matrix calculus. All these skills are critical to succeed in COMS 4771. 
  • You have a 24 hour window (from Saturday January 25, 2025 00:01 AM ET to Saturday January 25, 2025 11:59 PM ET) to take this quiz. You may open the quiz at any time in this 24 hour period, but as soon as you open the quiz you will only have 1 hour complete it and submit your responses on Courseworks. You must submit your quiz by the 11:59PM cutoff, regardless of when you start the quiz. This means you should start the quiz at 10:59PM by the latest so that you can have the full hour to complete it.
  • You will have only one attempt to complete this quiz; that means, once you have started, you must complete the quiz.
  • The score received on this quiz will be used to determine your enrollment in COMS 4771.

Resources

  • You may use any resource (books, online reference, etc.) to complete this quiz.
  • It may be useful for you to have access to a calculator.

 

Notation Used in this Quiz

  • P[.] denotes probability (of an event). 
  • E[.] denotes the expected value (of a random variable).
  • var[.] denotes the variance (of a random variable).
  • cov[. , .] denotes the covariance (between a pair or random variables).
  •  and   denotes natural numbers and the real number spaces respectively. 
  • "" denotes a definition. Example:   means the variable  is defined to be 3.
  • 1[.] denotes the indicator function. That is, 
  •  denotes independence. That is, A  B means A and B are independent.
  • T denotes the transpose operator.
  • inv(.) denotes the inverse operator.
  •  denotes the Euclidean norm.
